question: Which one of the following statements is not correct?
option1: The Press Council of India is an autonomous quasi-judicial body established under an Act of Parliament
option2: The Press Information Bureau provides accreditation to media persons so as to have easy access to information from government sources
option3: Among all the states of India, Maharashtra publishes the largest number of newspapers
option4: Press Trust of India is the largest news agency in the country
answer: Among all the states of India, Maharashtra publishes the largest number of newspapers
explanation: Madhya Pradesh publishes largest number of newspapers.
